result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Garcia-Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Ricardo Garcia-Vasquez was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ricardo Garcia-Vasquez is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Ricardo Garcia-Vasquez was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with child support orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

cfts that was spent in RCJ

Obtain/maintain full-time employment or employment / school to equal full time.
COMPLY WITH CHILD SUPPORT ORDERS.
No contact with:  DRUG USERS / DEALERS

costs / fine + CC

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

State calls Sgt Scott Krogh - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State calls Inv. Keith Dobesh - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #1 - DVD into evidence/received. DVD is played for the witness. State marks Ex #2- transcript of DVD. State moves Ex #2 into evidence/received. Cross xam by defense. Defense calls RGV - DSAT. Direct by defense. Cross by State. No further witnesses
Parties give argument.

BTC: The Court finds no merit in the defense due process argument. The Court is also satisfied that the statement regarding deft's statements being used in court is sufficient. The Court further finds that the defendant speaks adequate English to understand the questioning and finds no fault in any of the officers actions. The Court believes that under the totality of the circimstances, an adequate reading of the Miranda rights was read to the defendant and any statements may be utilized by the State in their case in chief and in rebuttal  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
